data.title: Message Year and Month
data.data_values: YY = last 2 digits of year; MM = 2 digit month
data.definition: This is the highest order field in the control field.

data.title: Message Week
data.definition: This field is also part of the control set and the week of the year the incident was reported.

data.title: Incident Number
data.definition: The incident number designates a single incident and is unique within the report week.

data.title: Corps Area
data.definition: The corps tactical zone within which the reported incident occurred. Must be entered.

data.title: Province
data.definition: The province within which the reported incident occurred. This table corresponds to that used by HES/HAMLA. Must be entered.

data.title: District
data.data_values: See HES/HAMLA code. Zero if unknown.
data.definition: Where known, the district within which the reported incident occurred. May be '0'.

data.title: Village
data.data_values: See HES/HAMLA code. Zero if unknown.
data.definition: Where known, the village in which the reported incident occurred. May be '0'.

data.title: Hamlet
data.data_values: See HES/HAMLA code. Zero if unknown.
data.definition: The hamlet in which the reported incident occurred. May be '0'.

data.title: Year
data.data_values: The last two digits of the year during which the reported incident occurred.
data.definition: N/A

data.title: Month
data.definition: The month during which the reported incident occurred.

data.title: Day
data.data_values: The calendar day of the month.
data.definition: The day of the month on which the reported incident occurred.

data.title: Time of Day
data.data_values: The 24-hour clock time at which the reported incident occurred; or 'day', 'nite', or 'UNK'
data.definition: N/A

data.title: UTM Coordinates
data.definition: The UTM coordinate of the incident.

data.title: Near Indicator
data.data_values: Blank: UTM coordinate is for the referenced hamlet; *: USID code is nearest population center to site of the incident
data.definition: N/A

data.title: Quarter of Year
data.definition: Quarter of year during which the reported incident occurred.

data.title: Prioritized Means
data.definition: The content of this field is determined after an examination of all the subsets of a unique incident's VCACT field. The means associated with the VCACT value that is placed in the PACT field becomes the PMEANS value.

data.title: Prioritized Action
data.definition: After the examination of all the subsets, this field is supplied with the VCACT of the highest priority according to the above order. The highest priority VCACT becomes the PACT value.

data.title: Prioritized Objective
data.definition: This field is the objective that was associated in the subset with the highest priority VCACT. The VCOBJ associated with the VCACT value placed in the PACT field becomes the POBJ value.

data.title: Size of Attacking Force
data.definition: The estimated size of the attacking force involved in the incident.

data.title: Segment Count
data.definition: The number of segments contained in a single reported incident. Multiple segments occur when any single incident reflects more than one means used, objective type, or type of action.

data.title: Period Set Counter
data.definition: Unknown

data.title: Primary Subfield Indicator
data.definition: This field indicates the relative importance of each segment within a single incident and is the same as the sequential order of the segment in which it appears.

data.title: Means Used Code
data.definition: The specific means used during execution of the incident.

data.title: Enemy Objective Code
data.definition: The specific objectives involved in the incident.

data.title: Enemy Action Code
data.definition: N/A

data.title: Count of Killed, Wounded, Damaged, or Destroyed
data.definition: This field shows the number of human casualties or damage or destruction of property in each segment of a given incident.

data.title: Primary Subfield Indicator 2
data.definition: This field indicates the relative importance of each segment within a single incident and is the same as the sequential order of the segment in which it appears.

data.title: Means Used Code 2
data.definition: The specific means used during execution of the incident.

data.title: Enemy Objective Code 2
data.definition: The specific objectives involved in the incident.

data.title: Enemy Action Code 2
data.definition: N/A

data.title: Count of Killed, Wounded, Damaged, or Destroyed 2
data.definition: This field shows the number of human casualties or damage or destruction of property in each segment of a given incident.
